lead_paragraph: Four months after the Taliban overtook Kunduz for two weeks, Afghan forces remain overstretched, and residents worry that the return of the insurgents is inevitable.

byline.contributor: Najim Rahim reported from Kunduz, and David Jolly and Ahmad Shakib from Kabul. Jawad Sukhanyar contributed reporting from Kabul.
byline.original: By NAJIM RAHIM, DAVID JOLLY and AHMAD SHAKIB

headline.print_headline: Kunduz Residents Live in Fear of Taliban’s Return
headline.main: Kunduz Residents Live in Fear of Taliban’s Return

snippet: Four months after the Taliban overtook Kunduz for two weeks, Afghan forces remain overstretched, and residents worry that the return of the insurgents is inevitable.
abstract: Citizens of Kunduz, Afghanistan fear return of Taliban insurgents who were chased from city by American and Afghan forces in September 2015; lack confidence that fractious government and weak Afghan army can protect them from continued threat of attack by militant forces regrouping on city's outskirts.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
